author: Special Correspondent
text:
Bharatiya Janata Party Puducherry unit general secretary V.Saminathan on Monday said the dress code should be implemented at all temples of Union Territory following the direction of the Madras High Court.

The party also demanded Hindu Religious Department to install the displays at the entrances of temples advising the visitors on what are the dresses they should wear while visiting the temples since the large number domestic and foreign tourists are visiting the UT temples every day.

In a press release, the Puducherry unit general secretary V. Saminathan pointed out temples in Tamil Nadu has implemented the dress code following the direction of the Madras High Court from January 1 and installed display boards on the dress code.

The devotees clad in garmetns such as half-trousers, leggings are not allowed inside the temples there, he claimed.

Foreign tourists

“Even foreign tourists who attracted to traditional Tamil culture, visit here with wearing traditional attire. Hence the government should take appropriate steps to preserve Tamil tradition and culture,” said Mr. Saminathan.

BJP demanded displays at temple entrances of advising visitors on what to wear
title: Implement dress code in temples, says BJP
